attributes.title: Stock verification
attributes.description:
Findings;

·       A stock take exercise was conducted on 22.04.25 to assess the effectiveness of internal controls that are put in place to safeguard company assets.

·       The following were the stock findings;

Ø  Bread variance- (-53.5 loaves)

Ø  Polybags- (+475 pcs)

Ø  Crates-   (-5 pcs)

                                                      

                                        Summary of the findings
attributes.recommendation: Further improvement of stock controls is needed to get rid of all variances.
attributes.effect: The variance noted in crates is an indication that stock controls are not adhered to.

value: I will improve on the overall controls.
Shortfall exceeded the set limit and was recovered.
No material variance in the stock items was reported in the previous audit findings.

attributes.title: Bread weight
attributes.description:
Findings;

·        Sample varieties of packed bread were randomly picked and weighed to establish whether the branch adheres to weights and measures standards.

·        Both sample varieties had few cases of underweight.

·        The underweight samples were spread as follows; 200g W- 11% and 400g W- 5%.

                     The table below summarizes the findings
attributes.recommendation: Weight controls should be maintained.
attributes.effect: Few cases of underweight is an indication that production standards are adhered to.

value: We will continue making improvements.
More control measures will be initiated.
Minimal cases of underweight were noted in the previous audit spot check.

attributes.title: Damages analysis
attributes.description:
·        Analysis of bread damages from 15.03.25 – 21.04.25 was done to verify if the level of bread damages was maintained within the set limits of 0.25% of the total production and 0.2% of the total sales.

·        A total of 815 loaves were damaged under production damages which represent 0.19% of the total loaves produced.

·        2,874 loaves were damaged under market damages (market returns and expired bread) representing 0.5% of the total sales over the audited period.

·        Market damages exceeded the set limit by 1,713 loaves worth Ksh. 91,645

Below is a summary table of the findings
attributes.recommendation: ·        The management to ensure that both production and market damages are maintained within the set limit by ensuring that production standards are adhered and quality bread is dispatch to the market.
attributes.effect: ·        Excess market damages worth Ksh. 91,645 is an indication that the company is exposed to losses due to excess damages.

value: Excess market returns was contributed by slow bread movement during the month of Ramadan.
Excess damages was contributed by slow bread movement. We are working to reduce the overall damages going forward.
Market damages exceeded the set limits by 366 loaves in the previous audit findings.
Previous

attributes.title: Mixing chart analysis
attributes.description:
Findings;

·        Comparison of manual mixing charts and the system mixing charts was done from 15.03.25 – 21.04.25 to find out if accurate transfer of production data was being done.

·        There was no material variance between system and the actual material usage.

·        No significant variance in bread posting was noted over the audited period.

Below are the summary of the findings
attributes.recommendation: The branch should continue observing the set production standards.
attributes.effect: Production standards were observed.

value: ·        We will maintain.
·        We will maintain.
No variances was reported in the previous audit findings.

attributes.title: Production Efficiency
attributes.description:
Findings;

·        Production efficiency was analyzed from 15.03.25 – 21.04.25 to find out if the branch achieved the set production target of 5 bags per worker.

·        The branch hired a total of 474 production workers over the audited period hence the expected production was 2,370 bags.

·        The actual production was 2,235 bags leading to a production shortfall of 135 bags.

Production efficiency
attributes.recommendation: ·        Management to improve on the planning of production workers to ensure that the set efficiency is consistently achieved.
attributes.effect: Production shortfall of 135 bags is an indication that the company incurred extra production costs worth Ksh. 29,322.

value: Improvement measures will be implemented
Corrective measures will be implemented to ensure that the set efficiency is achieved.
The set production target was not achieved in the previous audit findings and the extra labour cost incurred amounted to Ksh. 30,428

attributes.title: Packaging Efficiency
attributes.description:
Findings;

·        Packaging efficiency was analyzed from 15.03.25 – 21.04.25 to find out if the branch achieved the set efficiency of 97 crates per packer.

·        The total bread produced over the audited period is 31,869 crates hence the expected slicers to be hired was 329 workers.

·        The branch hired the exact packers required leading to a packaging efficiency of 96.9 crates per packer which is within the range.

The set efficiency was attained.
attributes.recommendation: ·        Proper planning of packers should be maintained.
attributes.effect: The set efficiency was achieved indicating that the planned packaging cost was observed.

value: To be maintained
To be maintained
Packaging efficiency of 94.8 crates per worker reported in the previous audit findings

attributes.title: Cash Verification
attributes.description:
Findings;

·        A spot check was done on cash office to verify if the branch petty cash was well kept and proper records maintained.

·        No material variances were noted on the spot-check day.
attributes.recommendation: The branch should ensure that patty cash records and balances are well maintained.
attributes.effect: ·        The immaterial variance noted in cash office is an indication that   effective controls are in place.

value: To be maintained.
To be maintained.
No variances were reported in the cash office in the previous audit findings.
Previous

attributes.title: Generator Fuel Analysis
attributes.description:
Findings;

·        Review of generator records was done to ascertain that its use is as per the set policies.

·        Comparison of manager records and system records was done to ensure accurate records and readings are maintained.

·        Physical machine hours and the system machine hours were matching.

·        The average fuel consumption rate was 16.7 Ltrs per hour which is within the range.

Summary of the findings
attributes.recommendation: Branch management to ensure that proper controls are always adhered.
attributes.effect: Generator fuel is well controlled

value: We will maintain
We will maintain
The average fuel consumption rate reported in the previous audit findings was 17.3 L/Hr.

attributes.title: Minishop spot-checks
attributes.description:
Finding;

·        Spot checks was done on the branch minishops; Mtwapa, Kanamai and Shanzu minishops to identify if company policies on minishops operations were being adhered to.

·        Stock variances were noted in Mtwapa- Ksh. 3,799, Kanamai- Ksh. 749 and Shanzu- Ksh. 3,852

Below are the details of the findings
attributes.recommendation: Stock variances should be recovered from the responsible individuals.
attributes.effect: Minishop SOPs are not adhered to leading to stock variances.

value: Deduction process have been initiated.
Recovery process is underway. There was a delay in recovery since the responsible shop attendant was not reporting to work. He already signed deductions.
No variances was reported in the previous audit findings.
